Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.description: Causes dark, water-soaked spots on leaves and fruits, leading to yellowing and premature drop.
Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.solution: Apply copper-based fungicides, avoid overhead watering, and remove affected plant parts.

Pepper__bell___healthy.description: The plant is healthy and shows no signs of bacterial or fungal infections.
Pepper__bell___healthy.solution: No treatment needed. Continue with regular care.

Potato___Early_blight.description: Characterized by concentric dark spots on older leaves, which can lead to leaf drop.
Potato___Early_blight.solution: Remove infected leaves, avoid wet foliage, and apply fungicides if necessary.

Potato___Late_blight.description: Dark lesions on leaves and stems, spreading quickly under wet conditions.
Potato___Late_blight.solution: Use resistant varieties, apply fungicides, and remove infected plants immediately.

Potato___healthy.description: The plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Potato___healthy.solution: No treatment needed. Maintain regular care and observation.

Tomato_Bacterial_spot.description: Dark, water-soaked spots appear on leaves, stems, and fruits, leading to leaf yellowing.
Tomato_Bacterial_spot.solution: Apply copper-based fungicides, avoid wetting foliage, and remove infected areas.

Tomato_Early_blight.description: Brownish spots with concentric rings appear on older leaves, eventually causing them to drop.
Tomato_Early_blight.solution: Remove affected leaves, avoid wet foliage, and consider fungicide application.

Tomato_Late_blight.description: Causes dark, water-soaked spots on leaves and stems, spreading rapidly under moist conditions.
Tomato_Late_blight.solution: Remove infected plants immediately, avoid overhead watering, and use fungicides.

Tomato_Leaf_Mold.description: Yellow spots on upper leaf surfaces and mold growth on undersides in humid conditions.
Tomato_Leaf_Mold.solution: Ensure good air circulation, avoid overhead watering, and apply fungicides.

Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.description: Small, circular spots with dark borders on leaves, leading to yellowing and leaf drop.
Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.solution: Remove infected leaves, avoid overhead watering, and apply fungicides if needed.

Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.description: Yellow stippling on leaves, eventually causing leaf browning and curling.
Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.solution: Use insecticidal soap or horticultural oils, and increase humidity to deter mites.

Tomato__Target_Spot.description: Brown lesions with concentric rings appear on leaves and stems.
Tomato__Target_Spot.solution: Apply fungicides, ensure good air circulation, and remove affected leaves.

Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.description: Yellowing and upward curling of leaves, leading to stunted growth.
Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.solution: Use virus-free transplants, control whiteflies, and remove infected plants.

Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.description: Mottling and mosaic-like patterns on leaves, with possible leaf curling.
Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.solution: Use resistant varieties, avoid handling plants when wet, and sanitize tools.

Tomato_healthy.description: The plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease or pests.
Tomato_healthy.solution: No treatment needed. Maintain regular care and observation.
